title: Expands the products which may be purchased for public use
summary: Expands the products which may be purchased for public use by including renewable energy resources; further increases the cost premium percentage of a product deemed reasonably competitive.

       AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to expanding  the
         products which may be purchased for public use

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 104-a of the general municipal law, as  amended  by
    2  chapter 468 of the laws of 1994, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S  104-a.  Purchasing  of products for public use.  1. Notwithstanding
    4  the provisions of section one hundred three of this  [chapter]  ARTICLE,
    5  when  purchasing  products the officer, board or agency of any political
    6  subdivision or of any district therein  charged  with  the  awarding  of
    7  public  contracts  may,  wherever RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCES OR recycled
    8  products meet contract specifications and the price of such products  is
    9  reasonably  competitive, purchase such products. For the purpose of this
   10  section [and until July first, nineteen  hundred  ninety-six,  "recycled
   11  product" shall mean any product which has been manufactured from second-
   12  ary  materials,  as  defined  in  subdivision one of section two hundred
   13  sixty-one of the economic development law, and meets secondary  material
   14  content  requirements  adopted  by  the office of general services under
   15  subdivision one of  section  one  hundred  seventy-seven  of  the  state
   16  finance  law  for  products  available  to  the political subdivision or
   17  district under state contract or, if no such contract for  such  product
   18  is  available,  any  product  which meets the secondary material content
   19  requirements adopted by the political subdivision  or  district  thereof

    1  with  respect to a specific commodity procurement by such entity. On and
    2  after July first, nineteen hundred ninety-six,]:
    3    (A) "recycled product" shall mean[, for the purposes of this section,]
    4  any  product  which is manufactured from secondary materials, as defined
    5  in subdivision one of section two  hundred  sixty-one  of  the  economic
    6  development  law, and which meets the requirements of subdivision two of
    7  section 27-0717 of the environmental conservation  law  and  regulations
    8  promulgated pursuant thereto[. For the purpose of this section,];
    9    (B)  "RENEWABLE  ENERGY RESOURCES" SHALL MEAN SOLAR, WIND, PHOTOVOLTA-
   10  ICS,  TIDAL,  GEOTHERMAL,  FUEL  CELL   TECHNOLOGIES   AND   LOW-IMPACT,
   11  RUN-OF-RIVER  HYDROELECTRIC  ELECTRIC GENERATING EQUIPMENT WITH CAPACITY
   12  UP TO THIRTY MEGAWATTS WITH NO NEW STORAGE IMPOUNDMENT; AND
   13    (C) "reasonably competitive" shall mean:
   14    (I) that the cost of the recycled  product  does  not  exceed  a  cost
   15  premium  of  ten  percent above the cost of a comparable product that is
   16  not a recycled product or, if at least fifty percent  of  the  secondary
   17  materials utilized in the manufacture of that product are generated from
   18  the  waste  stream  in  New York state, the cost of the recycled product
   19  does not exceed a cost premium of fifteen percent above the  cost  of  a
   20  comparable product that is not a recycled product; OR
   21    (II)  THAT THE COST OF THE RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCE DOES NOT EXCEED A
   22  COST PREMIUM OF FIFTEEN PERCENT ABOVE THE COST OF A  COMPARABLE  PRODUCT
   23  THAT IS NOT A RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCE.
   24    2.  Whenever such officer, board or agency shall purchase or cause the
   25  purchase of printing on recycled paper pursuant to this section,  he  or
   26  she  shall  require  the  printed material to contain the official state
   27  recycling emblem established pursuant  to  subdivision  two  of  section
   28  27-0717 of the environmental conservation law and regulations promulgat-

   31  ute and regulations, or, if such paper has not been so approved, require
   32  the printed material to include a printed statement which indicates  the
   33  percentages  of pre-consumer and post-consumer recycled material content
   34  of such paper.
